item.title: The kwa kwara, or korhaan malkop
item.summary: What the korhaan malkop or the kwa kwara (also known as the bustard, the black koran or Eupodotis afra) sings when people startle it and what it sings when it stands still on the ground.
item.comments: 1) p.6138v: (added 5 March 1879) see Song of the kwa kwara or korhaan malkop, 2) see also The story of the Kwa-kkwara and The Korhaan marries his elder sister (the Anteater's laws) 2), 2) This story is found in Book VIII-1
item.author: |hanâ‰ kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)
